definition: to journey to India on a quest for the Buddhist scriptures/to learn by studying another's experience
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing

sentences.english: The first lesson learned is that lessons can be learned.
sentences.chinese: 第一个条件是我们可以吸取经验教训。

sentences.english: As we do so, we must learn the lessons of the past.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，我们必须从以往工作中吸取经验教训。

sentences.english: Companies should learn from these school mottos.
sentences.chinese: 公司应该向这些校训取经。

sentences.english: White Horse is a member not to be ignored in the family to Western Paradise for Buddhist Scriptures.
sentences.chinese: 白龙马是取经集体中不容忽视的一员。

sentences.english: When we fail, we should make use of oue failure and learn from our experience.
sentences.chinese: 当我们失败时，就该充分利用失败，从中吸取经验。

sentences.english: In fact, there are two major sects of Buddhism in India, the Mahayana and the Hinayana .
sentences.chinese: 传说玄奘在印度取经时曾住在一座大乘佛寺内。

sentences.english: The bank is also gleaning knowledge from other corporations that invest in green solutions.
sentences.chinese: 银行还向其他投资于绿色解决方案的公司取经。

sentences.english: Local governments also look abroad and learn from European efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 地方政府到海外取经，学习欧洲国家的节能手段。

sentences.english: The below map shows the route Xuanzang went to India.
sentences.chinese: 下面的地图显示当年唐三藏到天竺取经的路线。

sentences.english: "It's not shameful to learn from successful models, " Wang says.
sentences.chinese: “从成功案例中吸取经验一点儿也不可耻，”王兴说。

sentences.english: Fox is ready to take advice from a 9-year-old.
sentences.chinese: 福克斯公司将从一个9岁的孩子那里取经。

sentences.english: We are all going to the west for Buddhist scriptures .
sentences.chinese: 我们几个是去西天取经的。

sentences.english: Of course, Jing Chunhai also constantly went to Crew 5 to learn from their experiences.
sentences.chinese: 当然景春海也不断地到5队来走动取经。

sentences.english: But they can take some lessons from Soleri.
sentences.chinese: 但它们可以从索拉尼那儿吸取经验教训。

sentences.english: The entire process of getting sutras can be said to have been guided by Tathagata Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 整个取经活动可说都是在如来佛的掌控之下。

sentences.english: His name was Xuan Zang and he traveled from China to India in the early Tang Dynasty to collect Buddhist scriptures.
sentences.chinese: 他的名字叫玄奘，唐朝初期，他从中国去往印度取经。

definition: Xuanzang (602-664) Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator, who traveled to India 629-645
the eight precepts (Buddhism)
Tripitaka (602-664), Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator who traveled to India 629-645/same as 玄奘
Zhu Bajie, character in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记, with pig-like characteristics and armed with a muckrake/Pigsy in Arthur Waley's translation
the Western Paradise (Buddhism)
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
Sha Wujing
Tripitaka (602-664), Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator who traveled to India 629-645/same as 玄奘
Xuanzang (602-664), Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator who traveled to India 629-645
Zhu Bajie 豬八戒|猪八戒[Zhu1 Ba1 jie4] or Zhu Wuneng, Pigsy or Pig (in Journey to the West)
to pass on scripture/to teach Confucian doctrine/to pass on one's experience
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]/Son Goku, the main character in Dragon Ball 七龍珠|七龙珠[Qi1 long2 zhu1]
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers from the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 You2 Ji4]
Sha Wujing
sutra/Taoist treatise
